name: places/ChIJy-SaHKhZwokRIvt41JMmfIY
formattedAddress: 34 E 32nd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 34 E 32nd St, New York, NY 10016, USA

editorialSummary.text: Plush rooms with free Wi-Fi & minifridges, plus an on-site bar and restaurant .

originalText.text: Stayed at HGU for a week over Christmas with my partner. Reception is open 24 hours which was super convenient as we arrived after midnight. There was a $100 deposit taken from our card which reduced our spending money that we weren’t expecting but was returned to our card within 48 hours of checking out. We stayed in a Deluxe Queen Room which was small but manageable considering how little we were in there. From our window we could peak a view of the Empire State Building a couple blocks away. Heating controls were in the room which was really useful coming from an Australian summer into NYC winter. Shower temp wasn’t overly hot and could be temperamental which was a negative for us as we like really warm showers. Reception staff were lovely and some were great at giving directions and helpful information (specifically the night male staff). Hotel is right next to a metro and short walking distance to attractions. Would definitely stay again.

originalText.text: Lovely hotel and in great NY location near the Korea town and many of the high end furniture shops, rug stores. Hotel breakfast area has a great server name Jacob who will help you with breakfast and coffee. Hotel offers very quick services when requested. Hallway has little musky smell coming from very old carpet. Hotel is well built and super quiet. We stayed in suites for three days.

text.text: Lovely hotel and in great NY location near the Korea town and many of the high end furniture shops, rug stores. Hotel breakfast area has a great server name Jacob who will help you with breakfast and coffee. Hotel offers very quick services when requested. Hallway has little musky smell coming from very old carpet. Hotel is well built and super quiet. We stayed in suites for three days.

originalText.text: I'm surprised by all the bad reviews. I've stayed here twice and had great stays. It's really hard to find an affordable hotel in nyc that is in a good location and I feel that this hotel does a decent job of that. The rooms are well designed with a desk to work from that helps a lot. The staff is also very nice. Samantha at the front desk was so pleasant and helpful during the stay. Her kindness went a long way. She treated us as if it was a 5 star hotel. Thank you ❤️

text.text: I'm surprised by all the bad reviews. I've stayed here twice and had great stays. It's really hard to find an affordable hotel in nyc that is in a good location and I feel that this hotel does a decent job of that. originalText.text: Great place to stay. The room was very clean, bathrooms was bright and used eco friendly soaps. Coffee shop super cute and lounger area. Free use of local gym next door with stay. Would definately stay here again.

text.text: Great place to stay. The room was very clean, bathrooms was bright and used eco friendly soaps. Coffee shop super cute and lounger area. Free use of local gym next door with stay. Would definately stay here again.

originalText.text:
Ok so I maybe wouldn’t put full 5 stars for all categories but wanted to give this hotel some love as many of the reviews here are terrible.

In response to some other reviews I’ve read: If you want 5 star accommodation and service, go to a 5 star hotel. I get that this is the price of a 5 star hotel most places, but prices in NYC are just crazy high so you’ve gotta adjust expectations.

For a 4 star hotel in Manhattan, this was great. We were given an early check-in free of charge and our room was really lovely. Surprisingly spacious for Manhattan. Incredibly comfortable mattress and bedding, we felt really rested staying there.

Location is brilliant, far enough downtown not to be in the full insanity of midtown and also right by the 6 subway which is great for regular trains up and down the city.

We also loved the value of the week gym membership for the gym next door included (but so be warned it’s a no-frill CrossFit gym).
